publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2082 Mark Ballard: Fairtrade Football Matchâ€”That the Parliament notes that the football match between Whitehill Welfare and Kelso United in the East of Scotland League Premier Division at Ferguson Park, Rosewell, Midlothian on 27 November 2004 at 2.00 pm will be played to support Fairtrade footballs; notes that Fairtrade ensures that handmade footballs are made in humane working conditions and that workers are ensured a fair price for their work; believes that Fairtrade has a significant role to play in improving the lives of workers in the global south and supports the use of Fairtrade footballs throughout Scottish football, and congratulates Whitehill Welfare on being the first club in Scotland to use Fairtrade footballs. Supported by: Chris Ballance*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Marlyn Glen*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Bill Butler*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Donald Gorrie*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Rosie Kane*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Frances Curran*, Trish Godman*
S2M-2082 Fairtrade Football Match (lodged on 26 November 2004) Linda Fabiani*
